Description: Pottery oil lamp. Mould-made, with a small circular reservoir with a central filling hole surrounded by crude circular decorative motifs and a diagonal criss cross pattern. The nozzle projects from the body and has incised decoration. Traces of burning through use. The bottom is blackened and has a sticker reading 1327" on it. Light red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Neo Hellenistic type, dated 25 BC - AD 300 (Młynarczyk 1998, Type S, fig. 185; Bailey 1988 dates this type later). 2nd to early 4th century AD parallel from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA III.2). Młynarczyk, J. 1997. Alexandrian and Alexandria-influenced mould-made lamps of the Hellenistic period. BAR International Series 677. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie : Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.43) (Phase 3)
